name: StructureDefinition
description: A definition of a FHIR structure. This resource is used to describe the underlying resources, data types defined in FHIR, and also for describing extensions and constraints on resources and data types.

elements.name: id
elements.short: Logical id of this artifact
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.short: Metadata about the resource
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.short: Language of the resource content
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.short: Contained, inline Resources
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.short: Additional content defined by implementations
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: url
elements.short: Canonical identifier for this structure definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
elements.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this structure definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this structure definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the structure definition is stored on different servers.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: identifier
elements.short: Additional identifier for the structure definition
elements.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this structure definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: version
elements.short: Business version of the structure definition
elements.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the structure definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the structure definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: name
elements.short: Name for this structure definition (computer friendly)
elements.description: A natural language name identifying the structure definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: title
elements.short: Name for this structure definition (human friendly)
elements.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the structure definition.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: status
elements.short: draft | active | retired | unknown
elements.description: The status of this structure definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: experimental
elements.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
elements.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this structure definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: date
elements.short: Date last changed
elements.description: The date  (and optionally time) when the structure definition was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the structure definition changes.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: publisher
elements.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
elements.description: The name of the organization or individual that published the structure definition.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contact
elements.short: Contact details for the publisher
elements.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: description
elements.short: Natural language description of the structure definition
elements.description: A free text natural language description of the structure definition from a consumer's perspective.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: useContext
elements.short: The context that the content is intended to support
elements.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate structure definition instances.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: jurisdiction
elements.short: Intended jurisdiction for structure definition (if applicable)
elements.description: A legal or geographic region in which the structure definition is intended to be used.

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: purpose
elements.short: Why this structure definition is defined
elements.description: Explanation of why this structure definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: copyright
elements.short: Use and/or publishing restrictions
elements.description: A copyright statement relating to the structure definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the structure definition.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: keyword
elements.short: Assist with indexing and finding
elements.description: A set of key words or terms from external terminologies that may be used to assist with indexing and searching of templates nby describing the use of this structure definition, or the content it describes.

binding.description: Codes for the meaning of the defined structure (SNOMED CT and LOINC codes, as an example).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: fhirVersion
elements.short: FHIR Version this StructureDefinition targets
elements.description: The version of the FHIR specification on which this StructureDefinition is based - this is the formal version of the specification, without the revision number, e.g. [publication].[major].[minor], which is 4.0.1. for this version.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: mapping
elements.short: External specification that the content is mapped to
elements.description: An external specification that the content is mapped to.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have at least a name or a uri (or both)

elements.name: id
elements.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

elements.name: extension
elements.short: Additional content defined by implementations
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: identity
elements.short: Internal id when this mapping is used
elements.description: An Internal id that is used to identify this mapping set when specific mappings are made.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: uri
elements.short: Identifies what this mapping refers to
elements.description: An absolute URI that identifies the specification that this mapping is expressed to.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: name
elements.short: Names what this mapping refers to
elements.description: A name for the specification that is being mapped to.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: comment
elements.short: Versions, Issues, Scope limitations etc.
elements.description: Comments about this mapping, including version notes, issues, scope limitations, and other important notes for usage.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: kind
elements.short: primitive-type | complex-type | resource | logical
elements.description: Defines the kind of structure that this definition is describing.

binding.description: Defines the type of structure that a definition is describing.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: abstract
elements.short: Whether the structure is abstract
elements.description: Whether structure this definition describes is abstract or not  - that is, whether the structure is not intended to be instantiated. For Resources and Data types, abstract types will never be exchanged  between systems.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: context
elements.short: If an extension, where it can be used in instances
elements.description: Identifies the types of resource or data type elements to which the extension can be applied.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: id
elements.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

elements.description:

Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: type
elements.short: fhirpath | element | extension
elements.description: Defines how to interpret the expression that defines what the context of the extension is.

binding.description: How an extension context is interpreted.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: expression
elements.short: Where the extension can be used in instances
elements.description: An expression that defines where an extension can be used in resources.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contextInvariant
elements.short: FHIRPath invariants - when the extension can be used
elements.description: A set of rules as FHIRPath Invariants about when the extension can be used (e.g. co-occurrence variants for the extension). All the rules must be true.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: type
elements.short: Type defined or constrained by this structure
elements.description: The type this structure describes. If the derivation kind is 'specialization' then this is the master definition for a type, and there is always one of these (a data type, an extension, a resource, including abstract ones). Otherwise the structure definition is a constraint on the stated type (and in this case, the type cannot be an abstract type).  References are URLs that are relative to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition e.g. "string" is a reference to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/string. Absolute URLs are only allowed in logical models.

binding.description: Either a resource or a data type, including logical model types.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: baseDefinition
elements.short: Definition that this type is constrained/specialized from
elements.description: An absolute URI that is the base structure from which this type is derived, either by specialization or constraint.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: derivation
elements.short: specialization | constraint - How relates to base definition
elements.description: How the type relates to the baseDefinition.

binding.description: How a type relates to its baseDefinition.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: snapshot
elements.short: Snapshot view of the structure
elements.description: A snapshot view is expressed in a standalone form that can be used and interpreted without considering the base StructureDefinition.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Each element definition in a snapshot must have a formal definition and cardinalities
constraints.xpath: count(f:element) = count(f:element[exists(f:definition) and exists(f:min) and exists(f:max)])

constraints.human: All snapshot elements must start with the StructureDefinition's specified type for non-logical models, or with the same type name for logical models
All snapshot elements must have a base definition

elements.name: element
elements.short: Definition of elements in the resource (if no StructureDefinition)
elements.description: Captures constraints on each element within the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
provide either a binding reference or a description (or both)

elements.name: differential
elements.short: Differential view of the structure
elements.description: A differential view is expressed relative to the base StructureDefinition - a statement of differences that it applies.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
No slicing on the root element
